channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Glenn Kessler’s Departure From WaPo Signals The End Of Media ‘Fact Checking’
item.description: The Washington Post's famed 'fact checker' is leaving the paper, a sure sign that one of the most toxic trends in journalism is dying off.

item.title: DOJ Files Complaint Against Judge Boasberg For ‘Improper’ Trump Comments Uncovered By Federalist Reporting
item.description: Bondi's announcement is paramount to restoring integrity in the judiciary.

item.title: Wiley Nickel exits North Carolina Senate race the day after Roy Cooper announces candidacy
item.description: A former congressman will no longer seek an open U.S. Senate seat in North Carolina next year now that fellow Democrat Roy Cooper is running for the p...

item.title: Just 32% of Americans approve of Israel's actions in Gaza
item.description: Americans' approval for Israel's war in Gaza is at an all-time low, with just 32% supporting the effort, according to new polling from Gallup.

item.title: Trump's religious rhetoric clashes with Canada's secular politics
item.description: Throughout his new term, starting with his inaugural address, President Trump has said he was "saved by God" to make America great again. In Canada, P...

item.title: The Russia Collusion Hoax Is Worse Than You Think
item.description: New revelations suggest a conspiracy at the heart of the Obama White House to target Trump as a Russian agent.

item.title: With AI plan, Trump keeps chipping away at a foundational environmental law
item.description: When President Trump rolled out a plan to boost artificial intelligence and data centers, a key goal was wiping away barriers to rapid growth.

item.title: Trump Wins a Round in the EU Trade War
item.description: But that doesn’t mean the war is a wise one for the sake of American prosperity.

item.title: Ukraine and Israel Offer a New Model for America’s Alliances
item.description: The U.S. must invest in those willing to share the risk, counter shared rivals, defend shared values, and compete where and when it matters most.

item.title: Consumer-Oriented Antitrust: Trump’s Course Correction Begins
item.description: Antitrust should be about outcomes, not outrage, and we hope it will soon revert back to that principle again.

item.title: Government shutdown talk is starting early ahead of a difficult funding fight in Congress this fall
item.description: It's become tradition. Congressional leaders from both major political parties blame each other for a potential government shutdown as the budget year...

item.title: Russiagate Wouldn’t Have Been Possible Without A Complicit Propaganda Press
item.description: The media can't honestly report on Russiagate because to do so would require acknowledging their role in helping foment the charade.

item.title: Hamas Is to Blame for Gaza’s Woes
item.description: The terror group considers the agony of Gazans a useful weapon in the narrative war. From this perverted point of view, a famine would be welcome news...

item.title: ‘Scene from a Horror Film’: The Southport Stabbing Spree, One Year Later
item.description: The murders of little girls may have been a practice attempt at mass killing on an even greater scale.

item.title: U.S. Border Patrol Blocks Pro-America War Hero From Leading New Classical College
item.description: Harold Ristau repeatedly put his life on the line for the United States in deployments to Iraq and Afghanistan.
